intro: Castanopsis tribuloides var. armata, commonly known as the armata tallowwood, is a species of evergreen tree native to northern Australia. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and beeches, and is characterized by its dense, hard timber. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stems. It produces small, cupule-bearing nuts that are an important food source for various wildlife. The tree is well adapted to the dry, sandy soils of its native habitat.
